main_definition: to take away or eliminate something from a position, place, group, or context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have something physically taken off one's body.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the accident, his broken arm was removed by doctors.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To eliminate or exclude someone from a position or role, often due to incompetence or misbehavior.
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager decided to remove John from his supervisory role because of frequent tardiness and poor performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take something out of a collection, group, or set. For example, when editing photos, you might remove unwanted elements.
meanings_and_examples.example: The editor removed the background clutter from the image to enhance its focus on the subject.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, it can mean removing a player from an active team due to injury or poor performance.
meanings_and_examples.example: Due to his knee injury, he was removed from the soccer team for this season.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To withdraw something that has been placed in another context. For instance, removing a bookmark from a page of a book.
meanings_and_examples.example: She carefully removed her red hair tie before putting on her cap.
